definition: a temporary stay (e.g., as a guest), assail or inflict
details:
noun
- a temporary stay (e.g., as a guest)
= synonyms: sojourn
- the act of going to see some person in a professional capacity
= example: the act of going to see some person in a professional capacity
- the act of visiting in an official capacity (as for an inspection)
- the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time
= example: the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time
- a meeting arranged by the visitor to see someone such as a doctor or lawyer for treatment or advice
= example: a meeting arranged by the visitor to see someone such as a doctor or lawyer for treatment or advice
verb
- assail or inflict
= example: assail or inflict
- impose something unpleasant
= example: impose something unpleasant
= synonyms: inflict, impose
- talk socially without exchanging too much information
= synonyms: chat, jaw, confab, chitchat, chit-chat, gossip, chatter, confabulate, chew the fat, shoot the breeze, chaffer, natter, claver
- go to certain places as for sightseeing
= example: go to certain places as for sightseeing
= synonyms: travel to
- come to see in an official or professional capacity
= example: come to see in an official or professional capacity
= synonyms: inspect
- pay a brief visit
= synonyms: call
- go to see a place, as for entertainment
= synonyms: see
- stay with as a guest
= example: stay with as a guest
